column4: I recently visited the CarePoint Clinic in Fall City to learn more about the services these volunteers provide. Now more than ever, we want to make sure that cost isn't a deterrent to accessing health care. Thanks for keeping our community healthy! https://t.co/5bPF0giWYm

Today I spoke with 3 frontline workers in our district about what it has been like to be essential workers during the pandemic. We can all do our part to help keep them safe by wearing masks and distancing when we go out. You can watch it in full here: https://t.co/DBqKFY0Ibu https://t.co/42UHFx81k3

The coronavirus has not gone away. I know how hard it has been for many of us to not see family and friends in person for the last six months. But we must continue to keep our distance when we're out of the house and wear masks. https://t.co/WUjKvlycZN

Today I was thrilled to speak with Dr. Larry Corey, President and Director Emeritus at Fred Hutch, about the process of developing a COVID-19 vaccine and what to expect from it: https://t.co/3OEzmCYyrX

It was great to meet with excellent partners like Director Sandison of @WSDAgov @NWHarvest @FoodLifeline, Cascadia Produce, and LINC Farmers‚Äô Cooperative this week to discuss how farmers and families have been affected by the pandemic. https://t.co/KknD2WpnFa

The ongoing pandemic has taken a physical and mental toll on many of us. It is ok to ask for help. On #WorldMentalHealthDay , I wanted to share a state resource, the Washington Listens Support Line: 833-681-0211, if you or a family member need to talk to someone.

Had a great visit w/ Dr. Elijah Lotz at the HealthPoint Renton High School Clinic. I was shown their telehealth system with a student, Michelle, on the line. We talked about how she is coping with remote learning and what the school clinic means to her. https://t.co/kpiZywbvpK

Wishing the President and First Lady a full recovery. COVID-19 is a horrible disease that has not gone away and is still prevalent in much of our country. Wear a mask, keep your distance from others, and don't give this virus a chance to spread to others.

It also included several of my bills to help the health and well-being of children and their families. The people in my district continue to struggle with the economic effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. We are one step closer to getting the help that our communities need.

200,000 Americans dead. That‚Äôs enough to fill three CenturyLink Fields. Three times the population of Auburn, the largest city in our district. Today I visited the site of 20,000 flags, each representing 10 people who have died from COVID-19. https://t.co/eLrWpTSgm4

Nationally, these courts save up to $13,000 for every individual they serve and return as much as $27 for every dollar invested. They treat the participant as a whole person, addressing housing, education, medical and mental health needs, and employment.

Thanks @ASP! We've got to take our time and get this right. We need a COVID-19 vaccine that is safe, effective, and accepted by the American people. Time and lots of rigorous testing will get us there. https://t.co/H4mf6AWuzq

The farming community needs immediate financial support to cover the costs of added worker safety protections while weathering the changes in markets caused by the pandemic. That is why I have introduced the Farm and Food Emergency Assistance Act.

As a pediatrician, a mom, & the daughter of a teacher, I look at reopening schools from many perspectives. To get this right, we first need to dramatically reduce community spread, which means wearing a mask and continuing to socially distance. Check out my op-ed below. https://t.co/QlKMDfz69h

It's #RuralBroadbandDay! The pandemic has shown that reliable internet access is more important than ever. It has allowed people to connect with their doctors and ensured our children can continue learning at home.

Today the House passed my amendment to increase funding so @CDCgov can research and get a better understanding of COVID-19 vaccine concerns within specific communities. Researchers across the globe are working on vaccines to protect us from COVID-19.

Thanks @ASP! We‚Äôve seen scientists around the world come together and make encouraging progress toward a COVID-19 vaccine. Once it is proven safe and effective, we'll need to do an equally difficult and impressive task of getting the world immunized. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/N0wzJLOhMl

I'm holding my next COVID telephone town hall tomorrow at 5pm PDT. I'll be joined by a representative from OSPI to talk school reopenings, or anything else COVID-related. You may get a call, but to ensure you can participate, sign up here: https://t.co/j1dXI96FBS https://t.co/tSnx5kK8HM

We‚Äôve made great progress in the 30 years since the ADA was signed. But there is still much more to do on employment, affordable health care, and the right to live independently for people with disabilities. You can bet that I‚Äôll keep fighting for these rights. #ADA30 https://t.co/ABu95Q8nrb
